items.title: EU cyber agency says airport software held to ransom by criminals
items.description: Brussels Airport asks airlines to cancel nearly half of their outgoing flights on Monday.

items.title: 'I'm Kenyan, don't shoot' - the athlete who says he was duped into the Russian army
items.description: Evans Kibet, now being held in Ukraine after surrendering, says he did not know he was signing up.

items.title: Botswana declares public holiday after 'historic' athletics gold medal
items.description: President Duma Boko congratulates the men's 4x400m relay team for winning gold at the World Athletic Championships.

items.title: Super typhoon hits Philippines as thousands evacuate
items.description: Ragasa has hit northern Philippines and is barrelling towards southern China.

items.title: South Korea would accept a Trump-Kim deal to freeze nuclear programme, president tells BBC
items.description: Lee Jae Myung tells the BBC he wants to restore trust with North Korea.
